channel.title: [317] Optimized Delta: Version 1.5
channel.description:
Link to original thread: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,498332.0.html][317] Optimized Delta[/url] (link has the older features)
so hi u lost the game i herd
Decided to release a better version of this source for noobs who want a 'fresh' start (I wouldn't really say fresh, just not that much content).
[b]NOTE:[/b] The different packet handling isn't finished, but it still works.
[b]Server Download[/b]: http://www.mediafire.com/?radk8bw4d21npa9 [b]Galkon's 474 look-alike[/b]: http://www.mediafire.com/?yta8too9aqbn8qj [b]Galkon's RuneLimited[/b]: http://www.mediafire.com/?w0qe1y423nsv024 -[b]Cache[/b]: http://www.mediafire.com/?7nw2si6yygheoee
Some of the things I did in 1.5:
[ul][li]Handled specials[/li] [li]Worked on combat calculations[/li] [li]Packets started to be handled entirely different (unfinished)[/li] [li]Commands are handled through a hashmap[/li] [li]A class.getInstance() to reduce static (thanks corey!)[/li] [li]Compatibility with Galkon's Refactored - yay![/li] [li][b]Compatibility with Galkon's RuneLimited client - glitchy![/b][/li] [li]Basic report abuse logging - for teh lulz[/li] [li]Process class removed[/li] [li]Object click glitch fixed[/li] [li]Basic codes rewritten to be more efficient[/li][/ul]
Some pictures:
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/1zlvwnp.gif[/img] [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/w7c31s.png[/img] [IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/nwzm8j.png[/img]
[b]To remove the debug messages:[/b]
1) Go to your Player class,
2) Find 'public boolean debug = true;'
3) Set it to false
Credits in the readme.
You must set the npcbits to use Galkon's client, it's currently set to be compatible with Galkon's 474, not runelimited

item.title: [317] Optimized Delta: Version 1.5
item.dc:creator: @kingdomkey01 kingdomkey01
item.description:
@kingdomkey01 wrote:

It depends on what client you use, RuneLimited uses 474 data, so it’ll load all 474 items :p. His 474 look-alike doesn’t load any new items.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

.\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: illegal start of expression public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: illegal start of expression public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: ';' expected public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: ')' expected public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: illegal start of expression public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: ';' expected public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: not a statement public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: ';' expected public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: <identifier> expected public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:281: not a statement int objectY) { // atobject2 ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:281: ';' expected int objectY) { // atobject2 ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Client location: class org.model.packets.ParsePackets public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:280: objectX is already defined in parseIn comingPackets(org.model.Client) public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX, ^ .\org\model\packets\ParsePackets.java:288: cannot find symbol symbol : method executeAction(org.model.Client,int,int,int) location: class org.model.packets.ParsePackets executeAction(client, objectID, objectX, objectY); ^ 14 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Optimized Delta: Version 1.5
item.dc:creator: @kingdomkey01 kingdomkey01
item.description:
@kingdomkey01 wrote:

Oh that’s why, fail

In your ObjectClick2 class,

Replace method packet252 with this

	public static void packet252(Client client, int objectID, int objectX,
			int objectY) {
		if (client.debug || (client.playerRights > 1))
			client.println_debug("atObject2: " + objectX + "," + objectY
					+ " objectID: " + objectID);
		if (!client.antiHax())
			return;
		client.TurnPlayerTo(objectX, objectY);
		executeAction(client, objectID, objectX, objectY);
	}

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Optimized Delta: Version 1.5
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

[quote=“kingdomkey01, post:17, topic:405707”][quote author=TheHolyGrail link=topic=502698.msg3687962#msg3687962 date=1311957822]

TheHolyGrail, replace your case 132 in ParsePackets class with this:

		case 132:
			int objectX = client.inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
			int objectID = client.inStream.readUnsignedWord();
			int objectY = client.inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
			int xDiff = Math.abs(client.absX - objectX);
			int yDiff = Math.abs(client.absY - objectY);
			ObjectClick.packet132(client, objectID, objectX, objectY, xDiff,
					yDiff);
			break;

That should fix it
[/quote]Thanks for the quick reply man, it worked.

That will fix the disconnecting too? :o

It should, if not, then I’ll check out why it disconnects you.[/quote]Yeah it fixed it, but when you second click an object it says you clicked it like 50+ times in cmd.

Read full topic

TheHolyGrail, replace your case 132 in ParsePackets class with this:

		case 132:
			int objectX = client.inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
			int objectID = client.inStream.readUnsignedWord();
			int objectY = client.inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
			int xDiff = Math.abs(client.absX - objectX);
			int yDiff = Math.abs(client.absY - objectY);
			ObjectClick.packet132(client, objectID, objectX, objectY, xDiff,
					yDiff);
			break;

That should fix it
[/quote]Thanks for the quick reply man, it worked.

That will fix the disconnecting too? :o[/quote]
It should, if not, then I’ll check out why it disconnects you.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Optimized Delta: Version 1.5
item.dc:creator: @kingdomkey01 kingdomkey01
item.description:
@kingdomkey01 wrote:

TheHolyGrail, replace your case 132 in ParsePackets class with this:

		case 132:
			int objectX = client.inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
			int objectID = client.inStream.readUnsignedWord();
			int objectY = client.inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
			int xDiff = Math.abs(client.absX - objectX);
			int yDiff = Math.abs(client.absY - objectY);
			ObjectClick.packet132(client, objectID, objectX, objectY, xDiff,
					yDiff);
			break;

That should fix it

Read full topic

What is the object click fix, it isn’t working, client freezes and then I get disconnected from server anytime I try to click an object.

item.title: [317] Optimized Delta: Version 1.5
item.dc:creator: @kingdomkey01 kingdomkey01
item.description:
@kingdomkey01 wrote:

vManlyMan:

I love these OptimizdDelta’s. Are you going to be releasing a v2?

Yes, I may release a version two with the packet handling finished, and some features.

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:8, topic:405707”]What’s your client?
Release it?[/quote]

I’ll try to configure it with the refactored, since my client does not work with this optimized delta.
